alert.note: Alert for Central Chaffee County Below 9000 Ft; Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Leadville Vicinity, Lake County Below 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 20 at 9:10PM MDT until May 21 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...HEAVY, WET SNOW EXPECTED TO CONTINUE OVERSPREADING THE SOUTHEAST AND CENTRAL COLORADO MOUNTAINS, AS WELL AS THE INTERSTATE-25 CORRIDOR, THROUGH TONIGHT CONTINUING INTO SATURDAY... .Heavy, wet snow will spread south across the central and southeast Colorado mountains, as well as the Interstate- 25 corridor, through tonight and continue into Saturday. The heavy, wet snow will have the potential to cause damage to trees and power lines. There will be large variability in total snow accumulations across the Interstate 25 corridor. Specifically, areas around Pueblo may receive only a few inches of snow, while higher elevations farther north into El Paso County and farther south into Huerfano County could locally receive over one foot of snow. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches, except 3 to 6 inches for Pueblo Vicinity/Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet. In Pueblo County, locally higher accumulations will be possible for elevations above 5500 feet including the Interstate-25 corridor near the El Paso County and the Huerfano County lines. * WHERE...Portions of the Continental Divide region, southern portions of the southeast Colorado mountains and mountain valleys, and Pueblo Vicinity/Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Heavy, wet snow could cause damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Overnight lows tonight are expected to fall below freezing across portions of Pueblo County. Take precautions to protect tender vegetation as well as exposed irrigation systems to prevent damage.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
